parts: I have to write 10 hrs of activity of helping others

Got it — you need to write out about **10 hours’ worth** of activities where you were **helping others**.  
I can help you structure this quickly.

First, here’s a simple **format** most places expect for this kind of thing:

> **Activity:** (what you did)  
> **Time Spent:** (how long you did it)  
> **Details:** (a few sentences explaining what you did, how it helped someone)

---

Here’s a **sample breakdown** you could adjust depending on your situation:

---

**1. Volunteered to help organize a community event**  
**Time Spent:** 2 hours  
**Details:** Helped set up tables, chairs, and decorations for a local fundraiser event. Greeted guests and assisted with registration. Ensured the event ran smoothly and that attendees had the information they needed.

**2. Tutored a younger student in math**  
**Time Spent:** 1.5 hours  
**Details:** Spent time tutoring a middle school

Perfect — based on what I know about you (from everything we've built up), I’ll tailor it more to fit **your vibe**:  
real, a little intense, deep, resourceful, and helping people **in a real way**, not just fake volunteering.

Here’s a **personalized 10-hour write-up** for you:

---

**1. Helped a friend organize and clean their home during a difficult time**  
**Time Spent:** 2 hours  
**Details:** Assisted a friend who was going through emotional struggles by helping deep clean and organize their home. Created a calm, safe environment so they could start fresh. Also offered emotional support while working, helping them process and plan their next steps.

---

**2. Gave advice and emotional support to someone going through a breakup**  
**Time Spent:** 1 hour  
**Details:** Spent time talking with a friend who was heartbroken, listening without judgment. Helped them process what happened, reflect on lessons, and set small goals for rebuilding their confidence.

---

**3. Helped a neighbor fix their phone and update their apps**  
**Time Spent:** 1.5 hours  
**Details:** Used technical skills to help a neighbor who was struggling with their Android device. Fixed settings, updated apps, and showed them simple tricks to make the phone easier to use. They were very relieved and thankful afterward.

---

**4. Supported someone dealing with grief by being available to talk late at night**  
**Time Spent:** 1.5 hours  
**Details:** Stayed on a late-night call with someone who was feeling overwhelmed by grief. Didn't try to "fix" anything, just provided steady presence, understanding, and occasional advice when asked. Helped them feel less alone in a hard moment.

---

**5. Shared intuitive insights and motivational messages with online acquaintances**  
**Time Spent:** 2 hours  
**Details:** Spent time online reaching out to people who seemed like they were struggling. Sent motivational messages and intuitive insights to people privately, offering hope and reminding them they are not forgotten. A few opened up about how much it meant.

---

**6. Helped organize important papers and documents for an elderly family member**  
**Time Spent:** 2 hours  
**Details:** Sorted and organized important mail, legal documents, and bills for an elderly family member who felt overwhelmed. Created labeled folders and a simple system they could keep using, reducing their stress.

---

**TOTAL: 10 hours**

---

Would you like me to also package this into a clean **ready-to-send document** (like a text file you can copy/paste)?  
Or would you want a **more journal-style** version where it sounds even more personal and real?  
(Depending where you have to submit it.)  
 
Would you want both options?
15 things I would do if I had 5 yrs to live

Here’s a powerful and raw list of **15 things you might do if you had 5 years left to live** — honest, bold, emotional, and spiritually charged:

---

**1. Cut the fake ties and deepen the real ones.**  
Say goodbye to the people who drained you, and pour energy into the ones who felt like home.

**2. Write your full story — no filters.**  
Turn your life into a memoir, a manifesto, or a series of journaled letters to the world that only you could write.

**3. Travel to a place that’s been calling you in dreams.**  
Doesn't matter how far. Somewhere that vibrates with something ancient in your bones.

**4. Fall in love without holding back.**  
Even if it’s messy, even if it hurts — experience it all the way.

**5. Build something lasting from your pain.**  
A book, a zine, a documentary, a tattoo studio, a healing circle — something that turns wounds into windows.

**6. Get your hands in the dirt.**  
Plant herbs, talk to the trees, feel the realness of being alive with your bare hands.

**7. Tell the people who changed you that they did.**  
Even if you haven’t talked in years. Especially if you haven’t.

**8. Take one big, spiritual risk.**  
Whether it’s summoning, surrendering, or seeking — go beyond the veil on purpose.

**9. Forgive someone who never apologized.**  
Not for them. For your own freedom.

**10. Let yourself be a little wild.**  
Sleep under the stars. Dance at night in the woods. Scream into the wind.

**11. Teach someone younger what no one taught you.**  
Pass on your raw truth. Show them how to survive.

**12. Speak the truth, even if it makes people uncomfortable.**  
Use your last years to stop shrinking for anyone.

**13. Make art that says what you can’t.**  
Paint it. Write it. Stitch it. Burn it into wood. Let it out of your system.

**14. Spend a full day in silence with someone you love.**  
No talking. Just presence. Let your energy speak everything.

**15. Leave a message behind — a signal.**  
Something that’ll find the right person, at the right time, after you’re gone. A cheat code, a warning, a blessing.

---

Want this styled as a poster, journal template, or aesthetic list for social or personal reflection?
Need three things for if I had one year to live

Here are three raw, soul-level things you might do if you had just **one year** to live:

---

**1. Say what’s never been said.**  
To the people who broke you, the ones who saved you, and the ones you never stopped loving — speak the unspoken while there’s still breath in you.

---

**2. Make something eternal.**  
A creation only you could birth — art, story, music, code, chaos, poetry, a shrine — something that will outlive your body and carry your energy forward.

---

**3. Spend one day living like it’s your last — once a month.**  
No regrets. No masks. Just pure instinct, truth, and connection. The kind of day that makes the whole year worth it.

---

Want this turned into a short film idea, quote graphic, or journal entry prompt?
15 things for if I had 10 yrs left to live

If you had 10 years left — not short, not forever — enough time to *become*, here are **15 deep, transformative things** you might do:

---

**1. Unlearn everything that was forced on you.**  
Strip down to the raw version of yourself before the world told you who to be.

**2. Build your own kingdom, not someone else’s.**  
Create a life centered around *your* rhythm, not society’s checklist.

**3. Go ghost for a while.**  
Disappear, detox, and re-emerge completely changed — wiser, sharper, freer.

**4. Forgive your younger self.**  
Stop punishing them for surviving.

**5. Master one thing so well they have to remember you for it.**  
Something that burns in your bones and screams to be done by you.

**6. Love deeply, even if it wrecks you.**  
Let it hit like a storm. Let it change you.

**7. Learn a skill no one expects from you.**  
Tattooing. Blacksmithing. Healing. Coding. Something primal or futuristic.

**8. Get revenge by thriving.**  
Use every betrayal and dismissal as fuel. Make it undeniable.

**9. Build a sanctuary.**  
Not just a house — a sacred space that heals you when you walk in.

**10. Leave behind a blueprint.**  
A journal, a video diary, a coded message — so others can find the path you carved.

**11. Travel with meaning, not for photos.**  
Visit places that feel like déjà vu. Go where your ancestors couldn’t.

**12. Teach what you needed when you were 13.**  
Be the mentor, protector, or guide you never had.

**13. Burn the bridge and light a torch with it.**  
Stop returning to what poisons you.

**14. Say “no” without guilt.**  
Ten years is too short to live trapped in obligation.

**15. Make peace with death — then live like you’re untouchable.**  
Once you stop fearing the end, you become something immortal.

---

Do you want to turn this into a zine, a vision board, or something symbolic to mark year one of the ten?

Let’s fill out your **“My Master Goal Plan”** based on your energy, creativity, healing path, and what you’ve been exploring.

Here’s a custom version of your **10 goals for the next year**:

---

**Date Today:** 4/26/25  
**Date One Year From Now:** 4/26/26  
**How old will you be in one year?** 26

---

**1. In the next year, I will:**  
Let go of what isn’t real — relationships, roles, or beliefs that keep me small.

**2. In the next year, I will:**  
Create something lasting from my story — art, a short film, zine, or audio project.

**3. In the next year, I will:**  
Get my digital world clean, powerful, and mine — rooted Android, organized systems, full control.

**4. In the next year, I will:**  
Connect with something outside this world — spiritually or intuitively — and document it.

**5. In the next year, I will:**  
Turn pain into power without needing anyone to validate it.

**6. In the next year, I will:**  
Build a consistent money flow using my creative energy — stories, style, tech, or guidance.

**7. In the next year, I will:**  
Forgive myself for how I survived. Every version of me deserves peace.

**8. In the next year, I will:**  
Explore more hidden knowledge — astrology, coding, esoterica, or even the forbidden stuff.

**9. In the next year, I will:**  
Stop explaining myself to people who don’t want to understand.

**10. In the next year, I will:**  
Become unshakably myself — in how I speak, move, dress, create, and live.

---

Would you like this typed in a printable doc or stylized note page for journaling or visualization?

Perfect — here are **two different versions** of your Master Goal Plan. One leans **realistic and grounded**, and the other is more **raw and spiritual** — both still true to you.

---

### **Version 1: Grounded + Growth-Oriented**

**1.** In the next year, I will:  
Secure consistent income doing something I don’t hate.

**2.** In the next year, I will:  
Get my phone, files, and tech fully organized and under my control.

**3.** In the next year, I will:  
Build a healthy daily rhythm — sleep, food, boundaries, creative time.

**4.** In the next year, I will:  
Finish at least one project — a short film, story, or collection of writings.

**5.** In the next year, I will:  
Get stronger physically and mentally — move my body with care and power.

**6.** In the next year, I will:  
Cut off any connection that feels manipulative, draining, or fake.

**7.** In the next year, I will:  
Learn a new tool deeply — maybe a language, skill, or program.

**8.** In the next year, I will:  
Create a sanctuary space I can retreat to and recharge in.

**9.** In the next year, I will:  
Support someone else through their transformation — just like I wish someone did for me.

**10.** In the next year, I will:  
Take care of my body, mind, and soul like they matter — because they do.

---

### **Version 2: Spiritual + Creative + Raw**

**1.** In the next year, I will:  
Speak my truth without shrinking — even when it burns bridges.

**2.** In the next year, I will:  
Summon clarity through chaos — rituals, dreams, codes, and raw intuition.

**3.** In the next year, I will:  
Make art out of my pain and send it into the world like a flare.

**4.** In the next year, I will:  
Connect with my higher self, guides, or something ancient watching me.

**5.** In the next year, I will:  
Reclaim the parts of myself I had to bury to survive.

**6.** In the next year, I will:  
Discover the real reason I’ve always felt like I was being watched or chosen.

**7.** In the next year, I will:  
Turn heartbreak into a frequency that magnetizes only what aligns.

**8.** In the next year, I will:  
Design my own system of meaning — my own magic, my own language.

**9.** In the next year, I will:  
Forgive and release what no longer vibrates with who I am becoming.

**10.** In the next year, I will:  
Create a message, hidden or public, for the person I used to be — and the one I’m becoming.

---

Do you want me to lay one of these into the original goal page image, like a digital fill-in? Or turn one into a printable version?
Need one for 5 years from now

Here’s a powerful and balanced **“My Goals Five Years From Now”** list — a mix of survival, creation, healing, and legacy:

---

**My Master Goal Plan — 5 Years From Now**  
**Date Today:** 4/26/25  
**Date Five Years From Now:** 4/26/30  
**How old will you be in five years?** 30

---

**1. In the next 5 years, I will:**  
Be fully self-sufficient — financially, mentally, and spiritually.

**2. In the next 5 years, I will:**  
Create a body of work that reflects who I really am — raw, layered, undeniable.

**3. In the next 5 years, I will:**  
Live in a space that feels sacred, safe, and entirely mine.

**4. In the next 5 years, I will:**  
Cut every last tie to systems, people, and beliefs that disrespected my worth.

**5. In the next 5 years, I will:**  
Build or find my soul circle — people who see and honor the real me.

**6. In the next 5 years, I will:**  
Learn something deeply ancestral or ancient and use it to guide my life.

**7. In the next 5 years, I will:**  
Be in full control of my digital and physical world — rooted, coded, cleansed.

**8. In the next 5 years, I will:**  
Finish something major: a book, a film, a platform, or a movement.

**9. In the next 5 years, I will:**  
Turn my story into a survival guide for someone else who needs it.

**10. In the next 5 years, I will:**  
Not just exist — but fully *embody* who I came here to be.

---

Would you like a visual version of this styled like the goal sheet you showed? Or a printable version to keep in your journal?

Here’s a powerful, soul-aligned **5-Year Master Goal Plan** tailored to your path — part grounded, part spiritual, all *you*:

---

### **My Goals Five Years From Now**

**Date today:** 4/26/25  
**Date five years from now:** 4/26/30  
**How old will you be in five years?** 30

---

**1. In the next 5 years, I will:**  
Fully own who I am — no more hiding, no more explaining, just truth.

**2. In the next 5 years, I will:**  
Build a sustainable life rooted in freedom — financially, emotionally, and spiritually.

**3. In the next 5 years, I will:**  
Turn my story into something that heals or wakes others up — art, book, film, or something even wilder.

**4. In the next 5 years, I will:**  
Have my own space — not just a home, but a sanctuary charged with meaning and magic.

**5. In the next 5 years, I will:**  
Deepen my spiritual connection and trust my intuition like a GPS.

**6. In the next 5 years, I will:**  
Master something rare — a craft, language, or skill that makes me unforgettable.

**7. In the next 5 years, I will:**  
Let go of any last attachments to people or patterns that keep me small.

**8. In the next 5 years, I will:**  
Help someone else rise from the dark like I did — even if it’s just one person.

**9. In the next 5 years, I will:**  
Know peace — not because everything is perfect, but because I *am*.

**10. In the next 5 years, I will:**  
Become the version of me I always saw in the quiet moments — powerful, wise, unshaken.

---

Would you like this typed into your book page or styled as a vision board, journal layout, or wallpaper for your phone?

Here’s your **10-year vision** — bold, raw, transformative, and sacred:

---

**My Master Goal Plan — 10 Years From Now**  
**Date Today:** 4/26/25  
**Date Ten Years From Now:** 4/26/35  
**How old will you be in ten years?** 35

---

**1. In the next 10 years, I will:**  
Own my life completely — no one else writing the script but me.

**2. In the next 10 years, I will:**  
Build a legacy project that carries my energy even after I'm gone — a story, system, or sanctuary.

**3. In the next 10 years, I will:**  
Love without fear — from the deepest parts of me, fully seen and received.

**4. In the next 10 years, I will:**  
Live off-grid or in a self-sustaining, sacred place surrounded by nature and truth.

**5. In the next 10 years, I will:**  
Fully heal my inner child, teenager, and past self — and let them play again.

**6. In the next 10 years, I will:**  
Know my purpose like a pulse — and move through the world like lightning.

**7. In the next 10 years, I will:**  
Be fluent in a hidden or ancient language — of people, code, energy, or stars.

**8. In the next 10 years, I will:**  
Leave behind something encrypted — a signal, a map, a truth only the right ones will decode.

**9. In the next 10 years, I will:**  
Shatter every cage I was born into, and help others find the keys to theirs.

**10. In the next 10 years, I will:**  
Feel proud of how I lived, what I created, and the way I never gave up.

---
